description: A federal judge in Washington said he’ll likely order Elon Musk’s government efficiency team to preserve records of its activities amid allegations that staff are using an encrypted messaging platform to communicate.
title: Judge Signals Musk’s DOGE Should Be Preserving Its Work Records

description: The Trump administration has terminated two decades-old, independent food safety advisory committees to the US Department of Agriculture.
title: Two USDA Food Safety Committees Disbanded Under Trump Order

description: Donald Trump kept up the pressure on Ukraine to move ahead with a peace deal as signals emerged that the Kremlin would be willing to accept a temporary truce under certain conditions.
title: Trump Keeps Pressure on Ukraine as Putin Seen Open to Ceasefire

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis won a censure motion in parliament late Friday, shoring up support for his government after criticism of its handling of Greece’s deadliest train crash that took place two years ago.
title: Greek PM Mitsotakis Survives Censure Motion in Parliament

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Gives Crypto a Seat at the Table in Washington

description: President Donald Trump said his trade disputes with Mexico and Canada would be good for the 2026 World Cup co-hosted with those two nations as he signed an executive order to create a task force to assist in organizing the tournament.
title: Trump Says Trade Tension With Mexico, Canada Good for World Cup

description: Mondelez International Inc. is asking regulators for permission to ignore a shareholder proposal that calls for greater transparency on the Oreo maker’s Russian operations.
title: Oreo-Maker Mondelez Turns to New SEC Guidance to Quiet Call for Russia Transparency

description: Advisers to President Donald Trump are sketching out potential Russia sanctions he could lift or tweak — including the oil price cap — if there’s progress in talks with Moscow on ending its war in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Weighs Ending Oil Price Cap If Russia Talks Progress

description: Emmanuel Macron’s approval rating rose to the highest level since June as the French president pushes for a European effort to back Ukraine, according to a poll by Ifop for Ouest-France.
title: Macron’s Approval Jumps in Poll as French Worry About Ukraine

description: The Trump administration is preparing to force more companies to stop working in Venezuela, increasing pressure on President Nicolas Maduro after ordering Chevron Corp. to end operations there, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Poised to Order More Companies to Stop Operating in Venezuela

description: Reform UK said the lawmaker touted by Elon Musk as a potential replacement for leader Nigel Farage twice threatened the party’s chairman and that it’s also investigating allegations of bullying in his offices.
title: UK Lawmaker Praised by Musk Accused of Threats by Reform Chair

description: The Canadian government will deploy C$6.5 billion ($4.5 billion) to help exporters reach new markets for Canadian products and help companies navigate the tariff war, officials announced Friday.
title: Canada Rolls Out $4.5 Billion Program to Aid Tariff-Hit Firms

description: The Trump Administration said it is canceling $400 million of federal grants and contracts to Columbia University, citing civil rights complaints against the Ivy League school by Jewish students.
title: Trump Hits Columbia With $400 Million in Federal Grant Cuts Over Antisemitism

description: President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order that will restrict eligibility for a government-run student loan forgiveness program, targeting individuals whose work for non-profits clashes with the administration’s immigration policies.
title: Trump Plans to Restrict Loan Forgiveness for Non-Profit Workers

description: Elon Musk’s cost-cutting crusade is trickling down to US statehouses.
title: DOGE Push Spurs State Copycats With Governors Eyeing Cost Cuts

description: President Donald Trump’s slew of tariffs means American farmers may not make that big shift to corn after all.
title: Trump Tariffs Threaten Big Shift to Corn as Inputs Get Pricier

description: President Donald Trump said he may implement reciprocal tariffs on Canadian lumber and dairy products as soon as Friday, threatening again to disrupt crossborder trade.
title: Trump Says He May Hit Canada With Dairy, Lumber Tariffs Soon

description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said there’s a chance to negotiate a broad trade agreement with India that addresses tariff imbalances as well as thorny issues for Washington like the South Asian nation’s purchase of Russian weapons and involvement in a BRICS push to dethrone the dollar.
title: Lutnick Sees US-India Deal Covering Tariffs, Weapons and Dollar

description: One of the first steps after the establishment of a US strategic Bitcoin Reserve and a separate stockpile of other digital assets will be an audit of how much cryptocurrency the government holds, according to a senior White House official who spoke before a industry summit today.
title: US to Start Audit of Current Crypto Holdings, White House Says

description: Police are intercepting calls and showing up at people’s homes, rattling some citizens and raising questions about privacy.
title: Inside Xi's Crackdown on Scams With China’s Huge Surveillance State

description: Three Bulgarian nationals were found guilty of spying for Russia in the UK as part of a sophisticated international espionage ring run by the fugitive ex-Wirecard chief operating officer.
title: Russian Spy Ring Run by Ex-Wirecard COO Convicted of Spying

description: Russia is willing to discuss a temporary truce in Ukraine provided there is progress toward a final peace settlement, according to people familiar with the matter in Moscow.
title: Putin Ready to Agree to Ukraine Truce With Conditions

description: Donald Trump’s trade war is causing chaos for farmers and food producers on both sides of the US-Canada border, as businesses grapple with how to disentangle supply chains that have been interconnected for decades.
title: Trump Tariffs Throw US-Canada Food Supply Chain Into Chaos

description: Romania’s far-right presidential frontrunner Calin Georgescu submitted his candidacy for May’s election, as uncertainty lingers around whether he’ll be allowed to run due to recent criminal charges.
title: Romanian Far-Right Candidate Applies to Enter Presidential Race

description: Russia’s population is declining at its quickest pace since the Covid-19 pandemic, even after President Vladimir Putin declared that a demographic turnaround is the country’s most important priority.
title: Russians Shun Putin’s Plea for More Babies as Population Shrinks

description: Russian forces have reclaimed some Ukrainian-held territory in the Kursk Region, threatening a potential bargaining chip that Kyiv could take into potential peace talks with Moscow.
title: Russia Close to Cutting Off Ukrainian Troops Fighting in Kursk

description: A federal trial in New Jersey shows how President Donald Trump’s move to curtail enforcement of a bedrock bribery law can upend criminal prosecutions.
title: Trump’s Bribery-Law Order Starts Upending Criminal Prosecutions

description: One person working with the United Nations peace-keeping mission to South Sudan and several members of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces were killed during an evacuation exercise in the north of the country.
title: UN Peacekeeper, South Sudan Soldiers Die in Evacuation Mission

description: President Donald Trump is confident that China’s President Xi Jinping won’t make a move on Taiwan when he is in the White House, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on CNBC.
title: Bessent Says Trump Confident No Xi Move on Taiwan in His Term

description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk said he wants to more than double the size of the country’s armed forces and provide military training to every citizen.
title: Polish Premier Tusk to Boost Army to Half a Million

description: Shadow edit campaigns and political disputes have created headaches for overwhelmed editors and administrators.
title: Wikipedia Roiled With Internal Strife Over Page Edits About the Middle East

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz has begun the heavy lifting required to shore up the parliamentary super-majority he’ll need to drive through his plan to unleash limitless defense spending.
title: Merz Is Working to Lock In Support for German Fiscal Shock Plan

description: Kenyan President William Ruto signed a power-sharing agreement with opposition leader Raila Odinga on Friday, months after deadly anti-government protests shook the nation.
title: Kenya’s Ruto Teams Up with Odinga to Consolidate Grip on Power

description: Chilean center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei pledged to crack down on crime and illegal immigration, while doubling economic growth, as she unveiled campaign priorities ahead of the November election.
title: Chile Presidential Candidate Evelyn Matthei Unveils Campaign Blueprint

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent warned that the US economy may see some disruption as the Trump administration shifts the basis for growth away from the government and toward the private sector.
title: Bessent Warns on ‘Detox Period’ for Economy, Touts Trump ‘Call’

description: Across Latin America, crime and insecurity fears are providing a boost to conservative politicians, who are seen by many residents as better suited to making their countries safer.
title: Crime Fears Offer Opening to Latin American Conservative Leaders

description: Chilean hard-right presidential contender Johannes Kaiser is now tied with Evelyn Matthei, who is widely considered the frontrunner, according to a new poll that marks a shock development in this year’s contest.
title: Chile’s Hard-Right Presidential Hopeful Ties With Frontrunner

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro’s approval rating sunk to a new low last month following a guerrilla offensive, cabinet infighting, and a spat with US leader Donald Trump.
title: Petro Approval Rating Drops as Guerrilla Violence Roils Colombia

description: Donald Trump has come, gone and returned to the White House, but Boeing Co. still hasn’t delivered the new Air Force One jet that he’s eager to board after it’s painted in a red, white and blue color scheme of his own invention.
title: Trump Wants a New Air Force One. Boeing Has About a Dozen Problems

description: The World Health Organization is asking some employees to consider early retirement as the United Nations agency seeks to cut costs following US President Donald Trump’s decision to withdraw.
title: WHO Offers Early Retirement to Cut Costs Ahead of US Exit

description: President Donald Trump wrote a letter this week to Iranian leader Ali Khamenei urging the Islamic Republic to enter negotiations and strike a deal preventing the development of nuclear weapons.
title: Trump Urges Iran to Negotiate on Nuclear Program

description: President Donald Trump said tariffs on Mexico and Canada could go higher than a 25% rate imposed earlier this week, injecting further uncertainty into trade policies that have rattled markets and left businesses on edge.
title: Trump Says Canada, Mexico Tariffs ‘Could Go Up’ Over Time

description: France’s Finance Minister Eric Lombard said the government is still in the early stages of planning how to finance a boost in its defense spending and investment.
title: France in Early Stages of Planning Defense Spending Boost

description: The tech magnate has many links to the new Trump administration and the cost-slashing effort led by Elon Musk.
title: Peter Thiel’s Network Is Quietly Shaping Trump’s Government

description: Colombia’s foreign minister still sees the US as a strategic partner under Donald Trump, saying she wants to reset diplomacy a month after President Gustavo Petro triggered a brief tariff war with a post on social media.
title: Colombia’s Top Diplomat Seeks US Reset After Petro’s Feud With Trump

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.Donald Trump’s relationship with Vladimir Putin is about to get its first big test on Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Trump’s Ukraine Strategy Faces a Putin Test

description: A chaotic geopolitical environment will force Europe to shoulder more and more of its defense burden, and that cost is likely to increase substantially, according to the European Union’s defense industry chief.
title: EU Needs Rapid Action to Close Military Gaps, Defense Chief Says

description: President Donald Trump’s frenzied tariff barrage has been marked by reversals and faulty rollouts, baffling US trading partners and businesses while raising questions about the aims of his signature policy.
title: Trump’s On-Again, Off-Again Tariff Strategy Sows Confusion

description: Massive fiscal stimulus and spending.
title: We Just Saw Europe's Biggest Week in Decades
Odd Lots: We Just Saw Europe’s Biggest Week in Decades (Podcast)

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has ruled out calling an election over the coming weekend, ending the chances of a national vote before May as a cyclone bearing down on the country disrupted the center-left Labor government’s planning.
title: Australia PM Albanese Signals Election to Come in May

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will travel to South Africa next month to discuss efforts to end Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Ukraine President to Hold Talks With South Africa’s Ramaphosa

description: Thailand defended its deportation of 40 Uyghur detainees to China last week as the “best solution” to avoid a backlash from Beijing, after a rights group said the move violated international law and the returnees could face torture.
title: Thailand Says It Sent Uyghurs Back to China to Avoid Backlash from Beijing

description: UK house prices fell in February, according to mortgage lender Halifax, suggesting that high borrowing costs and economic uncertainty could finally be weighing on the property market.
title: UK House Prices Edge Lower in February, Halifax Data Shows

description: A decision on a disbursement by the World Bank-linked Climate Investment Funds that would trigger a $2.6 billion green-finance package for South Africa may be made as early as Friday, people with knowledge of the matter said.
title: Decision Nears on $2.6 Billion of Green Funds for South Africa

description: Russia deployed missiles and drones in an overnight attack on Ukraine that targeted civilian and energy infrastructure, Ukraine’s Energy Minister German Galushchenko said in a post on Facebook on Friday.
title: Ukraine Says Russia Hit Energy Targets in Overnight Attack

description: US President Donald Trump repeated his criticism of India’s high tariffs, indicating the country remains a target of reciprocal duties set to take effect April 2.
title: Trump Slams India’s ‘Very High’ Tariffs as Modi Seeks Reprieve

description: A diplomatic solution to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is unlikely in the next six months as President Vladimir Putin is confident he will eventually prevail, Lithuania’s foreign intelligence service said in an annual report.
title: Lithuanian Spy Agency Says Diplomacy Unlikely to Work in Ukraine

description: A South Korean court has decided to release impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol from prison where he has been held following his arrest in January over his brief martial law declaration at the end of last year.
title: South Korea’s President Yoon to Be Released From Jail

description: The head of the International Atomic Energy Agency says more countries are considering whether they need their own deterrent.
title: Nuclear Watchdog Warns Trump May Spark New Atomic Arms Race

description: Peel Hunt’s Kallum Pickering joins Merryn Talks Money to discuss how geopolitical tumult has made secure energy more of an imperative.
title: Is There a Tradeoff Between Net Zero and UK Growth?

description: President Donald Trump’s return already had European governments panicking about how they were going to keep the transatlantic alliance from cracking up over the next four years. But his vice president is deepening concerns that splits with the US could become permanent.
title: Vance Stokes European Fears That Rift With US Will Outlast Trump

description: US President Donald Trump on Thursday criticized the US-Japan Security Treaty, highlighting how the US is obliged to protect Japan under the agreement but Japan does not offer the same security guarantees in return.
title: Trump Criticizes Security Treaty With Japan as Uneven

description: Crude is among the beneficiaries of President Donald Trump’s one-month reprieve on tariffs for some imports from Canada and Mexico, a boost to oil industry leaders initially concerned that it wouldn’t secure relief.
title: Canadian Crude Wins Reprieve From Trump’s Tariffs on Neighbors

description: China’s top diplomat presented the country as a force for stability, as Donald Trump shakes up the world economy with tariffs.
title: China Vows to Uphold Stability as Trump Reshapes World Order

description: Brazil plans to use a social fund that receives oil and gas exploration royalties to help boost the economy as opinion polls show President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity slumping to all-time lows.
title: Lula to Use $3.5 Billion Fund to Boost Economy as Approval Falls

description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said her country would review tariffs on Chinese shipments, a move that could give the Trump administration a win in its push to build a “Fortress North America” that blocks shipments from the Asian nation.
title: Mexico to Review China Tariffs in Potential Win for Trump

description: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi speaks at a press conference during the ongoing National People's Congress (NPC) in Beijing on March 7, 2025. (Photo by GREG BAKER / AFP) (Photo by GREG BAKER/AFP via Getty Images)
title: China's Foreign Minister Speaks as Tariffs, Geopolitical Risks Weigh

description: President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a new policy requiring US Justice Department attorneys to “demand” in court that challengers suing the administration should post money bonds if they win orders blocking his actions.
title: Trump Orders DOJ to Demand Money Bonds From Challengers in Court

description: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order to set up a strategic Bitcoin reserve and a stockpile of other digital assets, according to a post on X by White House crypto czar David Sacks.
title: Bitcoin Sinks After Trump’s Executive Order Disappoints Market

description: Donald Trump’s push to restrict US investments in China is testing what in theory should be an ironclad financial relationship — the tight link between Chinese shares trading in New York and Hong Kong.
title: Alibaba’s Sudden ADR Discount Shows Fear of US-China Decoupling
